revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Honorees
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Lord Florey, presents the awards and achievements of several distinguished scientists in various fields. Awardees include A. L. Hodgkin for his work on neurophysiology, R. A. Lyttleton for his contributions to astronomy and geophysics, J. C. Kendrew for his research on molecular structure, D. H. C. Husband for his engineering work on radio telescopes, H. W. Thompson for his spectroscopy research in chemistry, and D. H. Wilkinson for his work in nuclear physics.
